problematic: Crazy/insane, mild insult implying mental instability (romanized: meshuga)
Stupid/foolish, mild intellectual insult (romanized: tipesh)
Idiot, borrowed from English/Greek, mild insult (romanized: idiot)
Moron, from Russian, mild intellectual insult (romanized: debil)
Fool, biblical Hebrew term for stupid person (romanized: ksil)
Dumb/stupid, implies lack of intelligence (romanized: metumtam)
Shit, common profanity borrowed from Arabic, moderate severity (romanized: khara)
Dick/penis, also means weapon in Hebrew, moderate sexual profanity (romanized: zayin)
You dick, direct insult using sexual organ, can be used jokingly among friends (romanized: ya zayin)
Whore/prostitute, derogatory term for women (romanized: zona)
Maniac/asshole, implies crazy or antisocial behavior (romanized: manyak)
Scoundrel/dishonest person, implies moral corruption (romanized: menuval)
Low-class person, discriminatory term ruled offensive by Israeli courts (romanized: ars)
Bimbo, derogatory term for attractive but unintelligent woman (romanized: freha)
Go to hell, biblical curse meaning go to the devil (romanized: lech la'azazel)
Go fuck yourself, strong sexual curse commanding masturbation (romanized: tizdayen)
Go fuck yourself, full phrase commanding sexual self-gratification (romanized: lech lehizdayen)
Son of a whore, compound family insult attacking mother's reputation (romanized: ben zona)
Cunt/vagina, highly vulgar sexual organ reference (romanized: kus)
Your mother's cunt, compound sexual family insult from Arabic (romanized: kus emek)
To fuck, sexual verb meaning to have intercourse aggressively (romanized: lezayen)
Masturbating, someone engaging in self-gratification (romanized: mizdayen)
Piece, objectifying term for attractive woman, literally means piece (romanized: hatikha)
Slut/whore, highly derogatory sexual slur against women from Arabic (romanized: sharmuta)
Belly, derogatory term for fat person, focuses on stomach (romanized: gachon)
Scoundrel/villain, biblical term for morally corrupt person (romanized: naval)
Bastard, biblical term for illegitimate child, general insult (romanized: mamzer)
Pig, insulting comparison to non-kosher animal, implies uncleanliness (romanized: khazir)
Dog, common animal insult implying loyalty betrayal or lowness (romanized: kelev)
Donkey/ass, mild insult implying stupidity, biblical reference (romanized: chamor)
Fool, biblical/talmudic term for foolish person (romanized: shoteh)
Wicked person/villain, biblical term for evil character (romanized: rasha)
Retarded, offensive term for mentally disabled, highly inappropriate (romanized: mefager)
Non-Jew, can be neutral or derogatory depending on context and tone (romanized: goy)
Military slang for incompetent soldier, implies worthlessness (romanized: kuksinel)
Military slang for soldier who adapts/compromises principles, mild criticism (romanized: shokist)
Military slang for non-combat soldier, implies easier service (romanized: jobnik)
Senior soldier nearing discharge, military hierarchy term (romanized: pazamnik)
Military slang for soldier doing minimum work, implies laziness (romanized: mitchapsen)
Military slang for tired/complaining soldier (romanized: shavuz)
Military slang for someone who avoids duties/responsibilities (romanized: methaphen)
Garbage/trash, calling someone worthless or disgusting (romanized: zevel)
Piece of garbage, compound insult emphasizing complete worthlessness (romanized: hatikhat zevel)
Pederast, homophobic slur with sexual connotations, highly offensive (romanized: pederast)
Homo, derogatory shortening of homosexual, offensive slur (romanized: homo)
Lesbian, can be neutral term or slur depending on context (romanized: lesbit)
Come on/let's go, borrowed from Arabic, can be dismissive (romanized: yalla)
Bottom line/seriously, slang for getting to the point (romanized: tachles)
Really/wow, borrowed from Arabic, expression of surprise (romanized: wallah)
Enough/finished, borrowed from Arabic, shows finality (romanized: khalas)
Poor thing/pathetic, shows condescending pity, from Arabic (romanized: misken)
Dude/bro, term of endearment among young Israelis (romanized: kfara)
Slap, threat of physical violence, implies hitting (romanized: stira)
Beatings, plural form threatening physical violence (romanized: makot)
To hit you in the face, direct threat of facial violence (romanized: latet lecha al hapanim)
Shut your mouth, rude command to stop talking (romanized: tistom et hape)
Shut up, direct rude command to be quiet (romanized: shtok)
Go die, extreme death wish, highly offensive threat (romanized: telech lamut)
I will kill you, direct death threat, extremely serious (romanized: ani eherog otcha)
Curse, general term for curse or profanity, biblical origin (romanized: klala)
Cursed/damned, biblical curse wishing divine punishment (romanized: arur)
May his name be erased, severe religious curse wishing memory obliteration (romanized: yimach shmo)
To hell with you, biblical curse sending someone to demons (romanized: le'azazel itcha)
